Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
LevelObserver
public class Controller extends Object implements LevelObserver
The Controller class manages the flow of the game, including level transitions and stage setup.

This class implements the LevelObserver interface to handle level changes dynamically. It also uses reflection to load levels at runtime based on their class names, enabling flexibility in managing game stages.

Source Code: GitHub Link

  • Method Details

    • launchGame

      public void launchGame() throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      Launches the game, starting with the first level.

      This method loads the first level dynamically using reflection and initializes it on the stage.

      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class for the first level cannot be found.
      NoSuchMethodException - If the expected constructor for the level class is not found.
      SecurityException - If a security violation occurs during reflection.
      InstantiationException - If the level class cannot be instantiated.
      IllegalAccessException - If the constructor for the level class is inaccessible.
      IllegalArgumentException - If invalid arguments are passed to the level constructor.
      InvocationTargetException - If the level constructor throws an exception.

    • goToLevel

      private void goToLevel(String className) throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      Navigates to the specified level dynamically.

      This method uses reflection to load the level class, create an instance of it, and display it on the stage.

      Parameters:
      className - The fully qualified name of the level class.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class for the specified level cannot be found.
      NoSuchMethodException - If the expected constructor for the level class is not found.
      SecurityException - If a security violation occurs during reflection.
      InstantiationException - If the level class cannot be instantiated.
      IllegalAccessException - If the constructor for the level class is inaccessible.
      IllegalArgumentException - If invalid arguments are passed to the level constructor.
      InvocationTargetException - If the level constructor throws an exception.

    • onLevelChange

      public void onLevelChange(String nextLevel)
      Handles level changes by navigating to the specified next level.

      This method is triggered by levels when a transition is required and dynamically loads the next level.

      Specified by:
      onLevelChange in interface LevelObserver
      Parameters:
      nextLevel - The fully qualified class name of the next level.
